snippet: Dell has spent more on share repurchases than it earned throughout its life as a public company, and most of those repurchases were at prices well above current levels.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that Dell, which may attempt to return to private sphere at great expense, has spent more on share repurchases than it earned throughout its life as a public company; holds that company presents lesson in risks of mismanaging stock options.
lead_paragraph: Dell has spent more on share repurchases than it earned throughout its life as a public company, and most of those repurchases were at prices well above current levels.

headline.print_headline: Dell’s Ups and Downs With Options
headline.seo: Dell’s Ups and Downs With Options - High and Low Finance
headline.main: Dell’s Ups and Downs With Options
